title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8116.00 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8116.00 - General

State Regulations
(a) Route 37. The
eastbound and westbound roadways of Route 37 between the St. Lawrence county
line and the intersection of Routes 11 and 30, a distance of 26.8+- miles on
the St. Regis Indian Reservation and in the Towns of Bombay, Fort Covington, Westville, Malone and in the Village of Malone. (b) Route 11. The eastbound and westbound
roadways of Route 11 between the St. Lawrence county line and the Clinton
county line, a distance of 33.2+- miles in the Towns of Moira, Bangor, Malone, Constable, Burke and Chateaugay and the Villages of Chateaugay, Brushton and

Malone. (c) Route 3. The eastbound
and westbound roadways of Route 3 between the St. Lawrence county line and the

Oval Wood dish plant, a distance of 1.7+- miles in the Town of Altamont and the

Village of Tupper Lake, are hereby designated as an access highway for use by
48-foot long, 102-inch wide trailers and are not hereby designated as an access
highway for any other types of vehicles. (d) Route 122. The eastbound and westbound
roadways of Route 122 between the intersection of Route 11 and the intersection
of Route 37, a distance 37, a distance of 10.3+- miles in the Towns of Burke, Constable and Westville. (e) [Eff. until March 11, 1992, see also subd. (e) below.] Route 30. Route 30 between

Route 11 and Route 86 in the Towns of Malone, Duane and Brighton and the

Village of Malone. (e) [Eff. March
11, 1992, see also subd. (e) above.] Route 95. Route 95 between US Route 11 and

Route 37, a distance of 13+- miles in the Towns of Bombay and Moira. (f) Route 86. Route 86 between Route 30 and

Route 3 in the Towns of Brighton and Harrietstown, and the Village of Saranac

Lake. (g) Route 3. Route 3 between
the Oval Wood Dish Plant in Tupper Lake and the Essex county line, a distance
of 24.2+- miles in the Towns of Altamont and Harrietstown and the Villages of

Tupper Lake and Saranac Lake. (i) CR 55. CR 55 between Route 86 and the Essex county line in the Towns of

Brighton and Franklin. (k) Route
374. Route 374 between US Route 11 and the Franklin-Clinton county line, a
distance of 9.5+- miles in the Towns of Chateaugay and

Belmont. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
8116.00

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
